title: Emptiness
verses: Ecclesiastes 1:2 (WEB) — "“Vanity of vanities,” says the Preacher; “Vanity of vanities, all is vanity.”"

Isaiah 55:1-2 (WEB) — "“Hey! Come, everyone who thirsts, to the waters! Come, buy wine and milk, without money and without price. Why do you spend money for that which is not bread, and your labor for that which doesn’t satisfy? Listen diligently to me, and eat that which is good, and let your soul delight itself in richness.”"
John 6:35 (WEB) — "Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life. He who comes to me will not be hungry, and he who believes in me will never be thirsty.”"
Psalm 16:11 (WEB) — "You will show me the path of life. In your presence is fullness of joy. In your right hand there are pleasures forever more."

Philippians 3:8 (WEB) — "Yes most certainly, and I count all things to be loss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus, my Lord, for whom I suffered the loss of all things, and count them nothing but refuse, that I may gain Christ"
body: The ache of emptiness is a holy invitation. Christ Himself is the bread that satisfies the soul. Turn from lesser saviors and feast on the Living One; joy rises where He is treasured.
prayer: Lord Jesus, Living Bread, I turn from what cannot satisfy. Feed my heart with Your presence and truth until joy overflows. Amen.
